text.__SUMMARY__: Eulimella cerullii is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Pyramidellidae, the pyrams and their allies.
text.Description: The size of the shell varies between 3.5 mm and 7 mm. The thin, semitransparent, white shell is very glossy. The teleoconch contains ten whorls that are  flattened and with a slight suture. The columella has a small, tooth-like thickening.
text.Distribution:
This species occurs in the following locations:
European waters (ERMS scope)
Greek Exclusive Economic Zone
Portuguese Exclusive Economic Zone : Madeira (at a depth of 1100 m) 
Spanish Exclusive Economic Zone
